<TD WIDTH="1%" VALIGN="TOP">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
	If one would have assumed that the closing date of the deal was January&nbsp;19, 2016 (the actual closing date), the fair value of the derivative financial asset at December&nbsp;31, 2015 would have been &#128;8,367
	thousand.
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:18PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<I>
	Recognition of Clinical Trial Expenses
</I>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	We recognize expenses incurred in carrying out clinical trials during the course of each clinical trial in line with the state of completion of
	each trial. This involves the calculation of clinical trial accruals at each period end to account for incurred expenses. This requires estimation of the expected full cost to complete the trial as well as the current stage of trial completion.
	Clinical trials usually take place over extended time periods and typically involve a set-up phase, a recruitment phase and a completion phase which ends upon the receipt of a final report containing full statistical analysis of trial results.
	Accruals are prepared separately for each clinical trial in progress and take into consideration the stage of completion of each trial including the number of patients that have entered the trial and whether we have received the final report. In all
	cases, the full cost of each trial is expensed by the time we have received the final report. There have not been any material adjustments to estimates based on the actual costs incurred for each period presented.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:18PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<I>
	Share-based Payments Plans
</I>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	We determine
	the costs of the share-based payments plans (i.e., our warrant plans) on the basis of the fair value of the equity instrument at grant date. Determining the fair value assumes choosing the most suitable valuation model for these equity instruments,
	by which the characteristics of the grant have a decisive influence. This assumes also the input into the valuation model of some relevant judgments, like the estimated useful life of the warrant and the volatility.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:18PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<I>
	Pension Obligations
</I>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	The cost of a
	defined pension arrangement is determined based on actuarial valuations. An actuarial valuation assumes the estimation of discount rates, estimated returns on assets, future salary increases, mortality figures and future pension increases. Because
	of the long-term nature of these pension plans, the valuation of these is subject to important uncertainties.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT ; FONT-SIZE:8PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" ALIGN="CENTER">
	102
</P>
<A NAME="eolPage106"></A>
<P STYLE='PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE:ALWAYS'>
<HR SIZE="3" STYLE="COLOR:#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">
<H5 ALIGN="LEFT">
<A HREF="#D167585D20F_HTM_TOC">
	Table of Contents
</A>
</H5>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<I>
	Corporate Income Taxes
</I>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	Significant judgment is required in determining the use of tax loss carry forwards. We recognize deferred tax assets arising from unused tax
	losses or tax credits only to the extent that we have sufficient taxable temporary differences or there is convincing evidence that sufficient taxable profit will be available against which the unused tax losses or unused tax credits can be utilized
	by us. Management&#146;s judgment is that such convincing evidence is currently not sufficiently available and a deferred tax asset is therefore not yet recognized, except for two subsidiaries operating on a cost plus basis for the company a
	deferred tax asset was set up for an amount of &#128;1.7&nbsp;million as of December&nbsp;31, 2015.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	As of December&nbsp;31, 2015, we had
	a total of approximately &#128;265&nbsp;million of statutory tax losses carried forward of our continuing operations which may be partially offset by future statutory taxable profits for an indefinite period, except for an amount of approximately
	&#128;17&nbsp;million in Switzerland, Croatia, the United States and The Netherlands with expiry dates between 2018 and 2030. As of December&nbsp;31, 2015, the available tax losses carried forward in Belgium amounted to &#128;184 million.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:18PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<I>
	Long-term Management Bonus Provision
</I>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	Our
	executive committee members, together with other senior managers, are eligible to receive bonuses under the Senior Management Bonus Scheme established in 2006. Pursuant to the rules of the Senior Management Bonus Scheme, 50% of the bonus is paid
	immediately around year-end and the payment of the remaining 50% is deferred for three years. The deferred 50% component is dependent on our share price change relative to the Next Biotech Index (which tracks our peers). Our share price and the Next
	Biotech Index at the start and end of the three-year period is calculated by the average price over the preceding and last month of the three-year period, respectively.
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:6PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE:10PT" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="4%">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="3%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
	&#149;
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="1%" VALIGN="TOP">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
	If our share price change is better than or equal to the change in the Next Biotech Index, the deferred bonus will be adjusted by the share price increase/decrease and paid out.
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:6PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE:10PT" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="4%">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="3%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
	&#149;
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="1%" VALIGN="TOP">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
	If our share price change is up to 10% worse than the change in the Next Biotech Index, 50% of the deferred bonus will be adjusted by the share price increase/decrease and paid out, and the remainder will be forfeited.
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:6PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE:10PT" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="4%">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="3%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
	&#149;
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="1%" VALIGN="TOP">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
	If our share price change is more than 10% worse than the change in the Next Biotech Index, the deferred bonus will be forfeited.
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	Since the bonus is calculated by reference to our share price, it is accounted for as a cash-settled share-based payment under IFRS 2. The
	liability incurred is measured at the fair value of the liability. Until the liability is settled, the fair value of the liability is re-measured at the end of each reporting period and at the date of settlement, with any changes in fair value
	recognized in profit or loss for the period. Management judgment is required in determining the fair value.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT ; FONT-SIZE:8PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" ALIGN="CENTER">
	103
</P>
<A NAME="eolPage107"></A>

<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	Total revenues decreased by &#128;29.8&nbsp;million, or 43%, to &#128;39.6&nbsp;million for the year ended
	December&nbsp;31, 2015, from &#128;69.4&nbsp;million for the year ended December&nbsp;31, 2014. This decrease was mainly driven by lower recognition of non-refundable upfront payments and reduced milestone payments, as explained below.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	Revenue from non-refundable upfront payments related to the deferred recognition of upfront payments received under the agreements with
	AbbVie, amounting to &#128;111.6&nbsp;million in 2012 and &#128;49.6&nbsp;million in 2013, which were amortized over a period ranging from 21 to 42 months, based on the estimated period of our involvement.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT ; FONT-SIZE:8PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" ALIGN="CENTER">
	104
</P>
<A NAME="eolPage108"></A>
<P STYLE='PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE:ALWAYS'>
<HR SIZE="3" STYLE="COLOR:#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">
<H5 ALIGN="LEFT">
<A HREF="#D167585D20F_HTM_TOC">
	Table of Contents
</A>
</H5>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	At inception and as of December&nbsp;31, 2012, the period of involvement was estimated at 30
	months starting in March 2012. As from April 2013 and as of December&nbsp;31, 2013, we changed the estimate of our period of involvement to 34 months due to delays that occurred in clinical trials and changed our recognition of the remaining
	unrecognized upfront payments accordingly. As of June&nbsp;30, 2014 and December&nbsp;31, 2014, we changed the estimate of our period of involvement from 34 months to 39 months and 40 months, respectively, due to additional delays and changed our
	recognition of the remaining unrecognized upfront payments accordingly. As of June 30, 2015, we changed the estimate of our period of involvement from 40 months to 42 months, due to additional delays and changed our recognition of the remaining
	unrecognized upfront payments accordingly.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	Milestone revenues and costs reimbursements decreased by &#128;12.1&nbsp;million, or 61%, to
	&#128;7.6&nbsp;million for the year ended December&nbsp;31, 2015 compared to &#128;19.8&nbsp;million for the year ended December&nbsp;31, 2014. This decrease was primarily related to fewer milestones achieved in 2015 compared to 2014 as a result of
	the increasing proprietary nature of our pipeline programs. For the year ended December&nbsp;31, 2015, &#128;2.2&nbsp;million and &#128;1.2&nbsp;million of costs were reimbursed in relation with the CF and filgotinib collaboration agreements with
	AbbVie, respectively, and &#128;3.8&nbsp;million of milestones related to partnered programs with Servier were recognized. For the year ended December&nbsp;31, 2014, &#128;8.3&nbsp;million of milestones were recognized in relation with the CF
	collaboration agreement with AbbVie and &#128;11.5&nbsp;million of milestones primarily related to partnered programs with Janssen Pharmaceutica, Servier and GSK.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	Other revenues increased by &#128;1.7&nbsp;million, or 46%, to &#128;5.5&nbsp;million for the year ended December&nbsp;31, 2015 compared to
	&#128;3.8&nbsp;million for the year ended December&nbsp;31 2014, principally due to higher revenues from fee-for-service activities.
</P>
<EFX_UNIDENTIFIED_TABLE>

<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	Total other income was composed of grant income and other income and increased by &#128;0.4&nbsp;million, or
	2%, from &#128;20.7&nbsp;million for the year ended December&nbsp;31, 2014 to &#128;21.0&nbsp;million for the year ended December&nbsp;31 2015.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	Grant income decreased by &#128;2.6&nbsp;million, or 45%, from &#128;5.6&nbsp;million for the year ended December&nbsp;31, 2014 to
	&#128;3.1&nbsp;million for the year ended December&nbsp;31, 2015. The majority of this grant income was related to grants from a Flemish agency, representing approximately 94% of all reported grant income in both years. In many cases these carry
	clauses require us to maintain a presence in the same region for a number of years and invest according to pre-agreed budgets.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	The
	decrease in grant income was compensated by an increase in other income of &#128;2.9&nbsp;million, or 19%, from &#128;15.0&nbsp;million for the year ended December&nbsp;31, 2014 to &#128;17.9&nbsp;million for the year ended December&nbsp;31, 2015.
	Other income was primarily composed of:
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:6PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE:10PT" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="4%">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="3%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
	&#149;
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="1%" VALIGN="TOP">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
	Income from an innovation incentive system of the French government, which represented &#128;8.7&nbsp;million of other income for the year ended December&nbsp;31, 2015 compared to &#128;7.8&nbsp;million for the year
	ended December&nbsp;31, 2014
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:6PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>

	Income from Belgian R&amp;D incentives with regard to incurred R&amp;D expenses, which represented &#128;5.3&nbsp;million of other income for the year ended December&nbsp;31, 2015 compared to &#128;4.3&nbsp;million for
	the year ended December&nbsp;31, 2014
</TD>

<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	R&amp;D expenditure increased by &#128;18.6&nbsp;million, or 17%, to &#128;129.7&nbsp;million for the year
	ended December&nbsp;31 2015, from &#128;111.1&nbsp;million for the year ended December&nbsp;31, 2014. This increase was principally due to:
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:6PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE:10PT" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="4%">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="3%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
	&#149;
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="1%" VALIGN="TOP">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
	Increased R&amp;D personnel costs of &#128;4.8&nbsp;million, or 16%, from &#128;31.0&nbsp;million for the year ended December&nbsp;31, 2014 to &#128;35.9&nbsp;million for the year ended December&nbsp;31, 2015, which was
	explained by an enlarged workforce, higher warrant costs and a higher provision for short-term and long-term management bonus, mainly as a result of the evolution of our share price change relative to the Next Biotech Index on Euronext. Increased
	subcontracting costs of &#128;11.6&nbsp;million, or 21%, from &#128;54.3&nbsp;million for the year ended December&nbsp;31, 2014 to &#128;65.9&nbsp;million for the year ended December&nbsp;31, 2015. This cost increase was mainly driven by increased
	subcontracting costs of &#128;8.4&nbsp;million for the CF collaboration with AbbVie and to a lesser extent by the increase of &#128;4.2&nbsp;million in subcontracting costs for our other partnered and internal programs.
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:6PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE:10PT" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="4%">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="3%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
	&#149;
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="1%" VALIGN="TOP">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
	Intensified use of lab consumables was the main driver of the increase in disposables, lab fees and premises costs of &#128;1.9&nbsp;million, or 11%, from &#128;16.8&nbsp;million for the year ended December&nbsp;31,
	2014 to &#128;18.7&nbsp;million for the year ended December&nbsp;31, 2015.
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:6PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE:10PT" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="4%">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="3%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
	&#149;
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="1%" VALIGN="TOP">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
	Other operating expenses slightly increased by &#128;0.3&nbsp;million, or 3%, from &#128;8.9&nbsp;million for the year ended December&nbsp;31, 2014 to &#128;9.3&nbsp;million for the year ended December&nbsp;31, 2015.
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	The table below summarizes our R&amp;D expenditure for the years ended December&nbsp;31, 2015 and 2014, broken down by
	R&amp;D expenses under alliance and own funded R&amp;D expenses.
</P>

<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	R&amp;D expenditure under alliance increased by &#128;4.5&nbsp;million, or 6%, from &#128;76.3&nbsp;million
	for year ended December&nbsp;31, 2014 to &#128;80.8&nbsp;million for the year ended December&nbsp;31, 2015, mainly due to our CF program in collaboration with AbbVie. We also increased our investments in our own funded portfolio by
	&#128;14.1&nbsp;million, or 40%, from &#128;34.8&nbsp;million for the year ended December&nbsp;31, 2014 to &#128;48.9&nbsp;million for the year ended December&nbsp;31, 2015, primarily because GLPG1205 and GLPG1690 programs became own funded.
</P>

<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	General and administrative expenses amounted to &#128;13.9&nbsp;million for the year ended December&nbsp;31,
	2014 and increased by &#128;5.2&nbsp;million, or 38%, to &#128;19.1&nbsp;million for the year ended December&nbsp;31, 2015. This increase was principally due to personnel costs and directors fees, which increased by &#128;4.6&nbsp;million, or 58%,
	from &#128;8.1&nbsp;million for the year ended December&nbsp;31, 2014 to &#128;12.7&nbsp;million for the year ended December&nbsp;31, 2015, resulting from various effects, such as increased costs of share-based payments plans (warrant plans) and
	increased provision for short- and long-term management bonus, mainly as a result of the evolution of our share price change relative to the Next Biotech Index on Euronext. In addition, other operating expenses increased by &#128;0.6&nbsp;million,
	or 10%, from &#128;5.8&nbsp;million for the year ended December&nbsp;31, 2014 to &#128;6.4&nbsp;million for the year ended December&nbsp;31, 2015, mainly due to higher professional fees.
</P>
<EFX_UNIDENTIFIED_TABLE>

<TD NOWRAP VALIGN="BOTTOM">
<B>
	%&nbsp;
</B>
</TD>

<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT ; FONT-SIZE:8PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" ALIGN="CENTER">
	107
</P>
<A NAME="eolPage111"></A>
<P STYLE='PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE:ALWAYS'>
<HR SIZE="3" STYLE="COLOR:#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">
<H5 ALIGN="LEFT">
<A HREF="#D167585D20F_HTM_TOC">
	Table of Contents
</A>
</H5>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	Sales and marketing expenses increased by &#128;0.2&nbsp;million, or 19%, from
	&#128;1.0&nbsp;million for the year ended December&nbsp;31, 2014 to &#128;1.2&nbsp;million for the year ended December&nbsp;31, 2015.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:18PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<B>
<I>
	Restructuring
	and Integration Costs
</I>
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	The restructuring and integration costs amounted to &#128;0.7&nbsp;million for the year ended
	December&nbsp;31, 2014 and were entirely related to workforce reductions within certain of the R&amp;D operations.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:18PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<B>
<I>
	Fair Value Re-measurement of
	Share Subscription Agreement
</I>
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	On December&nbsp;16, 2015, we entered into a global collaboration for the development and
	commercialization of filgotinib with Gilead, in the framework of which Gilead committed to an upfront payment of $725 million consisting of a license fee of $300 million and a $425 million equity investment in our company by subscribing to new
	shares at a price of &#128;58&nbsp;per share, including issuance premium. This agreement was effectively completed and entered into force on January&nbsp;19, 2016 and the full payment was received.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	In connection with the agreement, we recognized a deferred income and an offsetting short-term financial asset (derivative) of
	&#128;39&nbsp;million upon signing of the share subscription agreement with Gilead as required under IAS 39. This financial asset initially reflects the share premium that Gilead committed to pay above our closing share price on the day of entering
	into the subscription agreement. Under IAS 39 the fair value of the financial asset is re-measured at year-end and again upon entering into force of the share subscription agreement on January&nbsp;19, 2016, when the financial asset expired.
	Variations in fair value of the financial asset are recorded in the income statement included in our consolidated financial statements appended to this Annual Report.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	The decrease in the fair value of the financial asset resulting from the increase in our share price between signing of the subscription
	agreement and December&nbsp;31, 2015 resulted in a negative, non-cash adjustment fair value charge of &#128;30.6&nbsp;million in the financial results. The subsequent increase in the fair value of the financial asset resulting from the decrease in
	our share price between January&nbsp;1, 2016 and January&nbsp;19, 2016 will result in a positive non-cash gain of &#128;57.5&nbsp;million in the financial result of the first quarter of 2016.
</P>
<EFX_UNIDENTIFIED_TABLE>
<A NAME="FIS_UNIDENTIFIED_TABLE_23"></A>

<A NAME="eolPage112"></A>
<P STYLE='PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE:ALWAYS'>
<HR SIZE="3" STYLE="COLOR:#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">
<H5 ALIGN="LEFT">
<A HREF="#D167585D20F_HTM_TOC">
	Table of Contents
</A>
</H5>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	Other financial income decreased slightly by &#128;0.3&nbsp;million, or 13%, from
	&#128;2.3&nbsp;million for the year ended December&nbsp;31, 2014 to &#128;2.0&nbsp;million for the year ended December&nbsp;31, 2015. The &#128;0.8&nbsp;million decrease in the effect of discounting long-term R&amp;D incentives receivables was
	partly compensated by a &#128;0.4&nbsp;million increase in currency exchange gains. For more information on currency exchange fluctuations on our business, please see the section of this Annual Report titled &#147;Item 11&#151;Quantitative and
	Qualitative Disclosures About Market Risk&#151;Foreign Exchange Risk.&#148;
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	Other financial expense increased by &#128;0.6&nbsp;million,
	or 77%, from &#128;0.9&nbsp;million for the year ended December&nbsp;31, 2014 to &#128;1.5&nbsp;million for the year ended December&nbsp;31, 2015. Net exchange loss amounts to &#128;0.7&nbsp;million for the year ended December&nbsp;31, 2015, as
	compared to &#128;0.5&nbsp;million for the year ended December&nbsp;31, 2014. Interest expenses are related to interests paid on financial lease.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:18PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<B>
<I>
	Tax
</I>
</B>
</P>

	summarizes our tax result for the years ended December&nbsp;31, 2015 and 2014.

<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	Current tax representing &#128;0.2&nbsp;million for the year ended December&nbsp;31, 2015 was related to taxes
	for subsidiaries operating on cost plus basis.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	Current tax recorded in 2014 for an amount of &#128;2.4&nbsp;million related to a tax
	provision for subsidiaries operating under cost plus transfer pricing arrangements, triggered by a tax audit.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	Deferred tax income of
	&#128;1.4&nbsp;million for the year ended December&nbsp;31, 2015 and &#128;0.3&nbsp;million for the year ended December&nbsp;31, 2014 both related to subsidiaries working on a cost plus basis.
</P>

<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	The service division was sold on April&nbsp;1, 2014. The above table illustrates the results of the
	discontinued operations included in the consolidated results of operations for the years ended December&nbsp;31, 2015 and 2014. For the year ended December&nbsp;31, 2014, results only relate to the period from January&nbsp;1, 2014 through the
	disposal on April&nbsp;1, 2014.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	Net income amounting to &#128;70.5&nbsp;million in 2014 was mainly driven by the &#128;67.5&nbsp;million
	gain on disposal of the service division.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT ; FONT-SIZE:8PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" ALIGN="CENTER">
	110
</P>

<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<B>
	Comparison of Years Ended December&nbsp;31, 2014 and 2013
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	The following table summarizes the results of our operations for the years ended December&nbsp;31, 2014 and 2013, together with the changes to
	those items.
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:12PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE CELLSPACING="0" CELLPADDING="0" WIDTH="92%" BORDER="0" STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE:10PT" ALIGN="CENTER">

<TD WIDTH="69%">
</TD>
<TD VALIGN="BOTTOM" WIDTH="6%">
</TD>
<TD>

<TD>
</TD>
<TD VALIGN="BOTTOM" WIDTH="6%">
</TD>
<TD>
</TD>
<TD>

<TD VALIGN="BOTTOM" WIDTH="6%">
</TD>

<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	Total revenue decreased by &#128;7.3&nbsp;million, or 9%, to &#128;69.4&nbsp;million for the year ended
	December&nbsp;31, 2014, from &#128;76.6&nbsp;million for the year ended December&nbsp;31, 2013. This decrease was mainly driven by lower recognition of non-refundable upfront payments, as explained below.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT ; FONT-SIZE:8PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" ALIGN="CENTER">
	111
</P>
<A NAME="eolPage115"></A>
<P STYLE='PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE:ALWAYS'>
<HR SIZE="3" STYLE="COLOR:#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">
<H5 ALIGN="LEFT">
<A HREF="#D167585D20F_HTM_TOC">
	Table of Contents
</A>
</H5>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	Upfront payments predominantly relate to our collaboration agreements with AbbVie for RA, CD and
	CF.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	Under the AbbVie RA and CD collaboration agreement, we received one-time, non-refundable, non-creditable upfront payments in the
	amount of $150 million (&#128;111.6 million) in March 2012 and $20 million (&#128;15.6 million) in connection with the first amendment to the collaboration agreement in May 2013. At inception and as of December&nbsp;31, 2012, the period of
	involvement was estimated at 30 months starting in March 2012. As from April 2013 and as of December&nbsp;31, 2013, we changed the estimate of our period of involvement to 34 months due to delays that occurred in clinical trials and changed our
	recognition of the remaining unrecognized upfront payments accordingly. As of June&nbsp;30, 2014 and December&nbsp;31, 2014, we changed the estimate of our period of involvement from 34 months to 39 months and 40 months, respectively, due to
	additional delays and changed our recognition of the remaining unrecognized upfront payments accordingly.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	Under the AbbVie CF
	collaboration program, we received a one-time non-refundable, non-creditable upfront payment of $45.0 million (&#128;34.0 million) in October 2013. Upfront revenue was recognized over the period of our involvement, which was estimated to last until
	the end of 2015.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	As such, amounts of &#128;51.8&nbsp;million and &#128;45.8&nbsp;million were recognized as upfront revenue for the years
	ended December&nbsp;31, 2013 and 2014, respectively.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	Milestone revenues decreased by &#128;0.7&nbsp;million, or 4%, to
	&#128;19.8&nbsp;million for the year ended December&nbsp;31, 2014 compared to &#128;20.5&nbsp;million for the year ended December&nbsp;31, 2013. This decrease was primarily related to fewer milestones achieved in 2014 compared to 2013 as a result of
	the maturing pipeline of our projects under alliance. For the year ended December&nbsp;31, 2014, $10 million of milestones (&#128;8.3 million) were recognized in relation with our CF collaboration agreement with AbbVie. Under the CF arrangement with
	AbbVie, we may be eligible to receive future milestone payments of up to $340 million depending on future progress of the collaboration. Further milestone payments of &#128;11.5&nbsp;million in 2014 primarily related to partnered programs with
	Janssen Pharmaceutica; Les Laboratoires Servier, or Servier; and GlaxoSmithKline, or GSK. For the year ended December&nbsp;31, 2013, &#128;20.5&nbsp;million of milestones primarily related to partnered programs with Janssen Pharmaceutica, Servier
	and GSK.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	Other revenues decreased by &#128;0.6&nbsp;million, or 14%, to &#128;3.8&nbsp;million for the year ended December&nbsp;31, 2014
	compared to &#128;4.4&nbsp;million for the year ended December&nbsp;31, 2013, principally due to lower revenues from fee-for-service activities.
</P>

<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	Total other income was composed of grant income and other income and increased by &#128;0.7&nbsp;million, or
	4%, from &#128;19.9&nbsp;million for the year ended December&nbsp;31, 2013 to &#128;20.7&nbsp;million for the year ended December&nbsp;31, 2014.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	The increase in total other income was primarily attributed to increased grant income, which increased by &#128;0.6&nbsp;million, or 12%, from
	&#128;5.1&nbsp;million for the year ended December&nbsp;31, 2013 to &#128;5.6&nbsp;million for the year ended December&nbsp;31, 2014. The majority of this grant income was related to grants from a Flemish agency, representing approximately 90% of
	all reported grant income in both years.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT ; FONT-SIZE:8PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" ALIGN="CENTER">
	112
</P>
<A NAME="eolPage116"></A>
<P STYLE='PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE:ALWAYS'>

	Table of Contents
</A>
</H5>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	Other income increased slightly by &#128;0.1&nbsp;million, or 1%, from &#128;14.9&nbsp;million
	for the year ended December&nbsp;31, 2013 to &#128;15.0&nbsp;million for the year ended December&nbsp;31, 2014. Other income was primarily composed of:
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:6PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE:10PT" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">

<TD WIDTH="4%">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="3%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
	&#149;
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="1%" VALIGN="TOP">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
	Income from an innovation incentive system of the French government, which represented &#128;7.8&nbsp;million of other income for the year ended December&nbsp;31, 2014 compared to &#128;8.1&nbsp;million for the year
	ended December&nbsp;31, 2013.
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:6PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>

	the year ended December&nbsp;31, 2013.

	&#128;2.2&nbsp;million for the year ended December&nbsp;31, 2013.

<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	R&amp;D expenditure increased by &#128;11.7&nbsp;million, or 12%, to &#128;111.1&nbsp;million for the year
	ended December&nbsp;31, 2014, from &#128;99.4&nbsp;million for the year ended December&nbsp;31, 2013. This increase was principally due to:
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:6PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE:10PT" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="4%">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="3%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
	&#149;
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="1%" VALIGN="TOP">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
	Increased R&amp;D personnel costs of &#128;1.7&nbsp;million, or 6%, from &#128;29.4&nbsp;million for the year ended December&nbsp;31, 2013 to &#128;31.0&nbsp;million for the year ended December&nbsp;31, 2014, which was
	explained by an enlarged workforce, principally on the Belgian site (Mechelen). This was driven to a large extent by the new CF alliance with AbbVie (signed in September 2013), and to a smaller extent by the development project portfolio,
	predominantly our filgotinib project for RA and CD.
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:6PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE:10PT" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="4%">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="3%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
	&#149;
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="1%" VALIGN="TOP">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
	Increased subcontracting costs of &#128;9.5&nbsp;million, or 21%, from &#128;44.8&nbsp;million for the year ended December&nbsp;31, 2013 to &#128;54.3&nbsp;million for the year ended December&nbsp;31, 2014. This cost
	increase was mainly driven by increased subcontracting costs of &#128;5.7&nbsp;million for the RA and CD collaboration with AbbVie, reflecting the progress of the filgotinib program. To a lesser extent subcontracting costs increased by
	&#128;2.9&nbsp;million for the CF collaboration with AbbVie.
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:6PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE:10PT" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="4%">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="3%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
	&#149;
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="1%" VALIGN="TOP">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
	Intensified use of lab consumables was the main driver of the increase in disposables, lab fees and premises costs of &#128;1.0&nbsp;million, or 6%, from &#128;15.8&nbsp;million for the year ended December&nbsp;31, 2013
	to &#128;16.8&nbsp;million for the year ended December&nbsp;31, 2014.
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:6PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE:10PT" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="4%">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="3%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
	&#149;
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="1%" VALIGN="TOP">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
	Other operating expenses slightly decreased by &#128;0.4&nbsp;million, or 5%, from &#128;9.4&nbsp;million for the year ended December&nbsp;31, 2013 to &#128;8.9&nbsp;million for the year ended December&nbsp;31, 2014.
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT ; FONT-SIZE:8PT">
	&nbsp;

</B>

<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	We track all R&amp;D expenditures against detailed budgets and allocated them by individual project. The table
	below summarizes our R&amp;D expenditure for the years ended December&nbsp;31, 2014 and 2013, broken down by program, together with the changes to those items.
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:12PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">

<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	R&amp;D expenditure under alliance increased by &#128;3.5&nbsp;million, or 5%, from &#128;72.8&nbsp;million
	for the year ended December&nbsp;31, 2013 to &#128;76.3&nbsp;million for the year ended December&nbsp;31, 2014, primarily due to increased spending on the new CF program with AbbVie, which represented &#128;14.9&nbsp;million for the year ended
	December&nbsp;31, 2014 compared to &#128;2.5&nbsp;million for the year ended December&nbsp;31, 2013. To a lesser extent, R&amp;D expenditure increased with regard to the RA and CD collaboration with AbbVie for filgotinib by &#128;5.3&nbsp;million,
	from &#128;28.6&nbsp;million for the year ended December&nbsp;31, 2013 to &#128;33.8&nbsp;million for the year ended December&nbsp;31, 2014. The movements above were partially offset by a decrease in other alliance costs, which explains the increase
	of the R&amp;D costs under alliance by only 5%, or &#128;3.5 million. We also increased our investments in our own funded portfolio by &#128;8.2&nbsp;million, or 31%, from &#128;26.6&nbsp;million for the year ended December&nbsp;31, 2013 to
	&#128;34.8&nbsp;million for the year ended December&nbsp;31, 2014.
</P>
<EFX_UNIDENTIFIED_TABLE>

<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	General and administrative expenses amounted to &#128;12.4&nbsp;million for the year ended December&nbsp;31,
	2013 and increased by &#128;1.5&nbsp;million, or 12%, to &#128;13.9&nbsp;million for the year ended December&nbsp;31, 2014. This increase was
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT ; FONT-SIZE:8PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" ALIGN="CENTER">
	114
</P>
<A NAME="eolPage118"></A>
<P STYLE='PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE:ALWAYS'>
<HR SIZE="3" STYLE="COLOR:#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">
<H5 ALIGN="LEFT">
<A HREF="#D167585D20F_HTM_TOC">
	Table of Contents
</A>
</H5>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	principally due to personnel costs, which increased by &#128;0.9&nbsp;million, or 13%, from &#128;7.2&nbsp;million for the year ended December&nbsp;31, 2013 to &#128;8.1&nbsp;million for the year
	ended December&nbsp;31, 2014, resulting from various effects, such as increased costs of share-based payments plans (warrant plans) and change in classification between R&amp;D and general and administrative expenditure for some management
	functions. In addition, other operating expenses increased by &#128;0.6&nbsp;million, or 11%, from &#128;5.2&nbsp;million for the year ended December&nbsp;31, 2013 to &#128;5.8&nbsp;million for the year ended December&nbsp;31, 2014, mainly due to
	higher professional fees.
</P>
<EFX_UNIDENTIFIED_TABLE>
<A NAME="FIS_UNIDENTIFIED_TABLE_33"></A>

<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	Sales and marketing expenses decreased by &#128;0.5&nbsp;million, or 32%, from &#128;1.5&nbsp;million for the
	year ended December&nbsp;31, 2013 to &#128;1.0&nbsp;million for the year ended December&nbsp;31, 2014.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:18PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<B>
<I>
	Restructuring and Integration Costs
</I>
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	The restructuring and integration costs amounted to &#128;0.7&nbsp;million for the year ended December&nbsp;31, 2014 and to
	&#128;0.3&nbsp;million for the year ended December&nbsp;31, 2013 and were entirely related to workforce reductions within certain of our R&amp;D operations.
</P>
<EFX_UNIDENTIFIED_TABLE>
<A NAME="FIS_UNIDENTIFIED_TABLE_34"></A>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:18PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">

</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	The following table summarizes our financial income and expense for the years ended December&nbsp;31, 2014 and 2013, together with the changes
	to those items.

<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	Other financial income increased slightly by &#128;0.1&nbsp;million, or 5%, from &#128;2.2&nbsp;million for
	the year ended December&nbsp;31, 2013 to &#128;2.3&nbsp;million for the year ended December&nbsp;31, 2014.

	&nbsp;

	Table of Contents
</A>
</H5>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	Other financial expense decreased by &#128;0.5&nbsp;million, or 38% from &#128;1.4&nbsp;million
	for the year ended December&nbsp;31, 2013 to &#128;0.9&nbsp;million for the year ended December&nbsp;31, 2014, primarily reflecting lower exchange rate losses arising from U.S. dollars. Interest expenses related to interests paid on financial lease.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:18PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<B>
<I>

</B>

	summarizes our tax result for the years ended December&nbsp;31, 2014 and 2013.

<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	Current tax recorded in 2014 for an amount of &#128;2.4&nbsp;million relates to a tax provision for
	subsidiaries operating under cost plus transfer pricing arrangements, triggered by a tax audit. Deferred tax recorded in 2014 for an amount of &#128;0.3&nbsp;million relates to one subsidiary operating on a cost plus basis for the company.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	Deferred tax charges representing &#128;0.7&nbsp;million for the year ended December&nbsp;31, 2013 related to the reversal of a deferred tax
	asset on tax losses carried forward in Croatia. Due to a revised business strategy of the subsidiary in 2013 (transition towards service company), the company would no longer be in a taxable position or even be profitable in the foreseeable future,
	which explained the reversal of the deferred tax asset.
</P>

<A NAME="eolPage120"></A>
<P STYLE='PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE:ALWAYS'>
<HR SIZE="3" STYLE="COLOR:#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">
<H5 ALIGN="LEFT">
<A HREF="#D167585D20F_HTM_TOC">
	Table of Contents
</A>
</H5>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	The service division was sold on April&nbsp;1, 2014. The above table illustrates the results of
	the discontinued operations included in our consolidated results of operations for the years ended December&nbsp;31, 2014 and 2013. For the year ended December&nbsp;31, 2014, results only relate to the period from January&nbsp;1, 2014 through the
	disposal on April&nbsp;1, 2014.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	Service revenues amounted to &#128;17.5&nbsp;million in the first quarter of 2014 which showed a strong
	increase compared to the revenue trend in 2013. Other income reported in 2014 represented income from R&amp;D incentives related to one quarter of activity. Services cost of sales, general and administrative expenses and sales and marketing expenses
	showed a slight increase compared to the trend of the operating costs in 2013, following the growth of the service division.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	Net income
	amounting to &#128;70.5&nbsp;million in 2014 was mainly driven by the &#128;67.5&nbsp;million gain on disposal of our service division.
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:18PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<EFX_LIQUIDITY_CAPITAL>
<A NAME="FIS_LIQUIDITY_CAPITAL"></A>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE:10PT" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="4%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
<B>
	B.
</B>
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
<B>
<A NAME="D167585D20F_HTM_TOC167585_18">
</A>
	Liquidity and Capital Resources
</B>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	To date, we have incurred
	significant operating losses. We have funded our operations through public and private placements of equity securities, upfront and milestone payments received from pharmaceutical partners under our collaboration and alliance agreements, payments
	under our fee-for-service contracts, funding from governmental bodies, interest income as well as the net proceeds from the sale of our service division. Our cash flows may fluctuate and are difficult to forecast and will depend on many factors. As
	at December&nbsp;31, 2015, our cash and cash equivalents amounted to &#128;340.3 million. For more information on our policies regarding financial instruments, please see &#147;Note 2&#151;Significant accounting policies&#151;Financial
	instruments&#148; included in our consolidated financial statements appended to this Annual Report.
</P>

<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	Cash and cash equivalents at December&nbsp;31, 2015 amounted to &#128;340.3 million.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	Net cash outflow from operating activities increased by &#128;39.0&nbsp;million to a &#128;114.6&nbsp;million outflow for the year ended
	December&nbsp;31, 2015 compared to a &#128;75.6&nbsp;million outflow for the year ended December&nbsp;31, 2014. The higher cash burn from operations recorded in 2015 was primarily explained by increased R&amp;D investments, &#128;15.9&nbsp;million
	less cash received from milestones and costs reimbursement, of which mainly &#128;5.9&nbsp;million in alliance related receivables for which revenues were recorded in 2013 and for which payment came in the first half of 2014.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT ; FONT-SIZE:8PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" ALIGN="CENTER">
	117
</P>
<A NAME="eolPage121"></A>
<P STYLE='PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE:ALWAYS'>
<HR SIZE="3" STYLE="COLOR:#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">
<H5 ALIGN="LEFT">
<A HREF="#D167585D20F_HTM_TOC">
	Table of Contents
</A>
</H5>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	The net cash inflow from investing activities decreased by &#128;124.9&nbsp;million to
	&#128;4.3&nbsp;million net cash outflow for the year ended December&nbsp;31, 2015 compared to &#128;120.6&nbsp;million net cash inflow for the year ended December&nbsp;31, 2014, which reflected &#128;130.8&nbsp;million of net cash&nbsp;and cash
	equivalents proceeds from the sale of the service operations to Charles River on April&nbsp;1, 2014 (&#128;129 million headline consideration adjusted with agreed price adjustments and costs of the sale for a total amount of &#128;1.9 million),
	decreased by &#128;7.4&nbsp;million held as escrow account and presented as restricted cash in our statement of financial position. Restricted cash amounted to &#128;10.7&nbsp;million for the year ended December&nbsp;31, 2014, and decreased to
	&#128;7.9&nbsp;million for the year ended December&nbsp;31, 2015. This decrease is related to (i)&nbsp;the release of the &#128;3&nbsp;million bank guarantee issued in 2013 for the rental of the new premises in France which expired on June&nbsp;30,
	2015 following the move to the new offices, (ii)&nbsp;the payment of a claim to Charles River by decrease of the escrow account, and (iii)&nbsp;a &#128;0.7&nbsp;million bank guarantee issued in September 2015 for the rental of new premises in The
	Netherlands (to replace the current premises) which will expire on October&nbsp;1, 2025.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	The net cash inflow from financing activities
	have increased by &#128;267.2&nbsp;million, from &#128;4.2 million net cash inflow for the year ended December&nbsp;31, 2014, to &#128;271.4&nbsp;million net cash inflow for the year ended December&nbsp;31, 2015. The substantial net cash inflow in
	2015 can primarily be attributed to &#128;259.4&nbsp;million of net new funds from the recent global offering and concurrent listing on the NASDAQ Global Select Market on May&nbsp;19, 2015. In addition, proceeds received on exercise of warrants
	contributed to cash generated by financing activities in 2015 for &#128;12.0&nbsp;million and to a lesser extent for &#128;4.4&nbsp;million in 2014.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	The consolidated cash flow table above included both continuing and discontinued operations. The table below summarizes our statement of cash
	flows from discontinued operations included in the table above for the years ended December&nbsp;31, 2015 and 2014.
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:12PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;

<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:18PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<B>
<I>
	Cash and Funding Sources
</I>
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	The table below summarizes our sources of financing, excluding warrant exercises, for the years ended December&nbsp;31, 2015, 2014 and 2013.
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:12PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE CELLSPACING="0" CELLPADDING="0" WIDTH="68%" BORDER="0" STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE:10PT" ALIGN="CENTER">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="69%">
</TD>
<TD VALIGN="BOTTOM" WIDTH="21%">
</TD>
<TD>
</TD>
<TD>
</TD>
<TD>
</TD>
</TR>
<TR STYLE="FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE:8PT">
<TD VALIGN="BOTTOM">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD VALIGN="BOTTOM">

<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	Our sources of financing in 2013 included a private placement providing total net proceeds of &#128;52.8
	million.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	On May&nbsp;19, 2015, we completed a global offering of 7,532,499 ordinary shares, a concurrent public offering in the United
	States and private placement in Europe, in which framework we offered 5,746,000 ordinary shares through a public offering in the United States in the form of ADSs, at a price of $42.05 per ADS, before underwriting discounts and 1,786,499 ordinary
	shares through a European private placement at a price of &#128;37.00&nbsp;per share, before underwriting discounts. The ADSs were evidenced by American Depositary Receipts,
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT ; FONT-SIZE:8PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" ALIGN="CENTER">
	118
</P>
<A NAME="eolPage122"></A>
<P STYLE='PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE:ALWAYS'>
<HR SIZE="3" STYLE="COLOR:#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">
<H5 ALIGN="LEFT">
<A HREF="#D167585D20F_HTM_TOC">
	Table of Contents
</A>
</H5>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	and each ADS represents the right to receive one ordinary share. The ADSs are listed on the NASDAQ Global Select Market under the symbol &#147;GLPG.&#148;
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	We received &#128;278.7&nbsp;million of gross proceeds from the global offering, decreased by &#128;19.4&nbsp;million of underwriter discounts
	and commission, and offering expenses, of which &#128;19.3&nbsp;million has been paid at December&nbsp;31, 2015 and &#128;0.1&nbsp;million remains to be settled in cash. Total net cash proceeds from the global offering amounted to &#128;259.4
	million.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	As of December&nbsp;31, 2015, we had no long-term debt, other than finance leases and advances from Oseo, a French public
	organization for innovation support, for &#128;0.4 million.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	Our ongoing financial commitments are listed in the section of this Annual
	Report titled &#147;Item 5.F.&#151;Tabular Disclosure of Contractual Obligations&#148; and mainly consist of operating lease obligations and purchase commitments.
</P>

<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	Cash and cash equivalents at December&nbsp;31, 2014 amounted to &#128;187.7 million.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	Net cash outflow from operating activities increased by &#128;77.4&nbsp;million to a &#128;75.6&nbsp;million outflow for the year ended
	December&nbsp;31, 2014 compared to a &#128;1.8&nbsp;million inflow for the year ended December&nbsp;31, 2013. The higher cash burn from operations recorded in 2014 compared to 2013 was primarily due to cash inflows in 2013 from our collaboration
	agreements with AbbVie. In first half of 2013 we received an upfront payment from AbbVie for $20 million (&#128;15.6 million) in connection with the first amendment to our collaboration agreement with AbbVie for filgotinib which expanded the initial
	development plan. In second half of 2013 we received an upfront payment of $45.0 million (&#128;34.0 million) in connection with our global collaboration agreement with AbbVie for CF.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	The net cash inflow from investing activities increased by &#128;132.6&nbsp;million to &#128;120.6&nbsp;million net cash inflow for the year
	ended December&nbsp;31, 2014 compared to &#128;12.0&nbsp;million net cash outflow for the year ended December&nbsp;31, 2013, reflecting &#128;130.8&nbsp;million of net cash and cash equivalents proceeds from the sale of the service division to
	Charles River on April&nbsp;1, 2014 (&#128;129 million headline consideration adjusted with agreed price adjustments and costs of the sale for a total amount of &#128;1.8 million) decreased by &#128;7.4&nbsp;million held as escrow and presented as
	restricted cash in our statement of financial position.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	The net cash inflow from financing activities decreased by
	&#128;50.3&nbsp;million, from &#128;54.5&nbsp;million net cash inflow for the year ended December&nbsp;31, 2013 to &#128;4.2&nbsp;million net cash inflow for the year ended December&nbsp;31, 2014. The substantial net cash inflow in 2013 can
	primarily be attributed to &#128;52.8&nbsp;million of net new funds from issuing ordinary shares through a private placement with institutional investors.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT ; FONT-SIZE:8PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN" ALIGN="CENTER">
	119
</P>
<A NAME="eolPage123"></A>

</H5>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	In addition, proceeds received on exercise of warrants contributed to cash generated by financing
	activities in 2014 and to a lesser extent in 2013.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	The consolidated cash flow table above included both continuing and discontinued
	operations. The table below summarizes the audited statement of cash flows from discontinued operations included in the table above for the years ended December&nbsp;31, 2014 and 2013.

<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:18PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<B>
<I>
	Payment of Dividends by Subsidiaries
</I>
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	The amount of dividends payable by our subsidiaries to us is subject to, among other restrictions, general limitations imposed by the corporate
	laws, capital transfer restrictions and exchange control restrictions of the respective jurisdictions where those subsidiaries are organized and operate.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	Of our cash and cash equivalents held outside of Belgium as of December&nbsp;31, 2015 and 2014, the amount of cash that would have been
	subject to withholding taxes if transferred to us by way of dividends and the amount of cash that could not have been transferred by law was in each case immaterial.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:18PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<B>
<I>
	Funding Requirements
</I>
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	Based on
	conservative assumptions, excluding any payment from our collaboration agreement with Gilead, we believe that our existing cash and cash equivalents will enable us to fund our operating expenses and capital expenditure requirements at least through
	the next two to three years. We have based this estimate on assumptions that may prove to be wrong, and we could use our capital resources sooner than we currently expect.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	Our present and future funding requirements will depend on many factors, including, among other things:
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:6PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE:10PT" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="4%">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="3%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
	&#149;
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="1%" VALIGN="TOP">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
	the terms and timing of milestones, in-licensing payments and expense reimbursement payments, if any, from our collaboration and alliance agreements;
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:6PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE:10PT" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">

	We may raise additional capital through the sale of equity or convertible debt securities. In such an event, your ownership interest may be
	diluted, and the terms of these securities may include liquidation or other preferences that adversely affect your rights as a holder of the ADSs or our ordinary shares.
</P>

<A NAME="eolPage124"></A>
<P STYLE='PAGE-BREAK-BEFORE:ALWAYS'>
<HR SIZE="3" STYLE="COLOR:#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">
<H5 ALIGN="LEFT">
<A HREF="#D167585D20F_HTM_TOC">
	Table of Contents
</A>
</H5>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	For more information as to the risks associated with our future funding needs, see the section of
	this Annual Report titled &#147;Item 3.D.&#151;Risk Factors&#151;Risks Related to Our Financial Position and Need for Additional Capital.&#148;
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:18PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<B>
	Capital Expenditures
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	Our commitments for
	capital expenditures as of December&nbsp;31, 2015 amount to &#128;0.4 million.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	Our capital expenditures amounted to
	&#128;6.7&nbsp;million, &#128;2.8&nbsp;million and &#128;8.2&nbsp;million for the years ended December&nbsp;31, 2015, 2014 and 2013 respectively.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	In 2015, our capital expenditures were primarily related to laboratory equipment for &#128;2.2&nbsp;million, leasehold improvements mainly for
	our new building in Leiden (The Netherlands) for &#128;2.2&nbsp;million, &#128;1.7&nbsp;million for other tangible fixed assets and &#128;0.6&nbsp;million of intangible assets primarily related to software development.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	In 2014, we invested &#128;1.2&nbsp;million in laboratory equipment, &#128;0.9&nbsp;million in other tangible assets and
	&#128;0.7&nbsp;million in intangible assets primarily related to software development.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	In 2013, our capital expenditures were mainly
	related to laboratory equipment for &#128;5.5&nbsp;million, other tangible assets for &#128;2.1&nbsp;million and software development for &#128;0.5 million.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:18PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<B>
	JOBS Act Exemptions
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	We qualify as an
	&#147;emerging growth company&#148; as defined in the JOBS Act. As an emerging growth company, we may take advantage of specified reduced disclosure and other requirements that are otherwise applicable generally to public companies. These provisions
	include:
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:6PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE:10PT" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="4%">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="3%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
	&#149;
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="1%" VALIGN="TOP">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
	not being required to comply with the auditor attestation requirements of Section&nbsp;404 of the Sarbanes-Oxley Act of 2002, or the Sarbanes-Oxley Act; and
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:6PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE:10PT" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="4%">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="3%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
	&#149;
</TD>
<TD WIDTH="1%" VALIGN="TOP">
	&nbsp;
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
	to the extent that we no longer qualify as a foreign private issuer, (1)&nbsp;reduced disclosure obligations regarding executive compensation in our periodic reports and proxy statements; and (2)&nbsp;exemptions from
	the requirements of holding a non-binding advisory vote on executive compensation, including golden parachute compensation.
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	We may take advantage of these exemptions for up to five years or such earlier time that we are no longer an emerging growth company. We would
	cease to be an emerging growth company upon the earliest to occur of (1)&nbsp;the last day of the fiscal year in which we have more than $1.0 billion in annual revenue; (2)&nbsp;the date we qualify as a &#147;large accelerated filer,&#148; with at
	least $700 million of equity securities; (3)&nbsp;the issuance, in any three-year period, by our company of more than $1.0 billion in non-convertible debt securities held by non-affiliates; and (4)&nbsp;the last day of the fiscal year ending after
	the fifth anniversary of our initial public offering. We may choose to take advantage of some but not all of these exemptions. For example, Section&nbsp;107 of the JOBS Act provides that an emerging growth company can use the extended transition
	period provided in Section&nbsp;7(a)(2)(B) of the Securities Act for complying with new or revised accounting standards. Given that we currently report and expect to continue to report under IFRS as issued by the IASB, we have irrevocably elected
	not to avail ourselves of this extended transition period and, as a result, we will adopt new or revised accounting standards on the relevant dates on which adoption of such standards is required by the IASB. We have taken advantage of reduced
	reporting requirements in this Annual Report. Accordingly, the information contained herein may be different than the information you receive from other public companies in which you hold equity securities.
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:18PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE:10PT" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="4%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
<B>
	C.
</B>
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
<B>
<A NAME="D167585D20F_HTM_TOC167585_19">
</A>
	Research and Development
</B>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	For a discussion of our R&amp;D
	activities, see &#147;Item 4.B.&#151;Business Overview&#148; and &#147;Item 5.A.&#151;Operating Results.&#148;
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT ; FONT-SIZE:8PT">
	&nbsp;

<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE:10PT" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">

<B>
<A NAME="D167585D20F_HTM_TOC167585_20">

	D.

<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
<B>
	Trend Information
</B>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	Other than as disclosed elsewhere in this Annual Report, we are not
	aware of any trends, uncertainties, demands, commitments or events for the period from January&nbsp;1, 2015 to December&nbsp;31, 2015 that are reasonably likely to have a material adverse effect on our net revenues, income, profitability, liquidity
	or capital resources, or that caused the disclosed financial information to be not necessarily indicative of future operating results or financial conditions. For a discussion of trends, see &#147;Item 4.B.&#151;Business Overview,&#148; &#147;Item
	5.A.&#151;Operating Results,&#148; and &#147;Item 5.B.&#151;Liquidity and Capital Resources.&#148;
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:18PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE:10PT" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR>
<TD WIDTH="4%" VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT">
<B>
<A NAME="D167585D20F_HTM_TOC167585_21">
</A>
	E.
</B>
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
<B>
	Off-Balance Sheet Arrangements
</B>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	During the periods presented, we did not and do not
	currently have any off-balance sheet arrangements as defined under SEC rules, such as relationships with unconsolidated entities or financial partnerships, which are often referred to as structured finance or special purpose entities, established
	for the purpose of facilitating financing transactions that are not required to be reflected on our balance sheets.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:18PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<B>
	Contingent Liabilities and Assets
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	On March&nbsp;13, 2014, we announced the signing of a definitive agreement to sell the service division operations to Charles River
	Laboratories International, Inc., or Charles River, for a total consideration of up to &#128;134 million. Charles River agreed to pay us an immediate cash consideration of &#128;129 million. The potential earn-out of &#128;5&nbsp;million due upon
	achievement of a revenue target 12 months after transaction closing has not been obtained. Approximately 5% of the total consideration, including price adjustments, is being held on an escrow account. To date, four claims have been introduced by
	Charles River, of which three claims have been settled for a total amount of &#128;1.0 million. One claim is still being investigated. An amount of &#128;0.3&nbsp;million has been accrued in March 2015 based on a preliminary estimate of the
	exposure. The release of the escrow account will be possible after final agreement between the parties on the amounts at stake. Following the divestment, we remain guarantor for a limited transitional period in respect of the lease obligations for
	certain U.K. premises amounting to &pound;4&nbsp;million future rent payments. Charles River will fully indemnify us against all liabilities arising in connection with the lease obligation. We evaluated the risk to be remote. Finally, following
	common practice, we have given customary representations and warranties which are capped and limited in time.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	In the course of 2008, a
	former director of one of the subsidiaries sued for wrongful termination and seeks damages of &#128;1.1 million. We believe that the amount of damages claimed is unrealistically high. In 2014, the court requested an external advisor to evaluate the
	exact amount of damages. Considering the defense elements provided and the recent judgment in the court in our favor, our board and management evaluated the risk to be remote to possible, but not likely. Accordingly, it was decided not to record any
	provision in 2015 as the exposure was considered to be limited.
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:18PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE:10PT" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">

	office and laboratories which qualify as operating leases. We also have certain purchase commitments with contract research organization subcontractors principally. Future events could cause actual payments to differ from these estimates. On
	December&nbsp;31, 2015, we had outstanding obligations for future minimum rent payments and purchase commitments, which become due as follows:

<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE:10PT" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">

<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
<B>
	Directors and Senior Management.
</B>

</TABLE>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<B>
	Our Board of Directors
</B>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:6PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	We currently have seven directors, less than a majority of whom are citizens or residents of the United States.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	Under our articles of association, our board of directors must be composed of between five and nine members, of which at least three are
	independent directors as defined by the Belgian Companies Code. Half of the members of our board of directors must be non-executive directors. Within these limits, the number of directors is determined by our shareholders. Directors are elected,
	re-elected and may be removed at a shareholders&#146; general meeting with a simple majority vote of our shareholders. Pursuant to our articles of association, our directors serve four-year terms.
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN-TOP:12PT; MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT; TEXT-INDENT:4%; FONT-SIZE:10PT; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	The following table sets forth certain information with respect to the current members of our board of directors, including their ages, as of
	December&nbsp;31, 2015:
</P>
<P STYLE="FONT-SIZE:12PT;MARGIN-TOP:0PT;MARGIN-BOTTOM:0PT">
	&nbsp;
</P>

<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE:10PT" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">

	The term of the mandates of the directors will expire immediately after the annual shareholders&#146; meeting held in the year set forth next to the director&#146;s name.

<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE:10PT" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">

	(3)
</TD>

	Member of the audit committee.
